original_prompt:
ralph ulw: 아래의 이슈 해결 이후 사이드 이펙트도 추가적으로 분석해서 해결 In `@src/components/SettingsManager/sidebar/PresetPanel.tsx`:
- Around line 571-573: The success timeout in PresetPanel (where
setApplyError(null); setApplySuccess(true); setTimeout(() =>
setApplySuccess(false), 2000); is used) should be tracked in a ref (e.g.,
applySuccessTimeoutRef) so it can be cleared before creating a new timeout and
during the component's existing cleanup; update the Apply-Here handler to clear
any existing timeout via the ref before calling setApplySuccess(true) and store
the new timeout id in the ref, and ensure the cleanup effect clears
applySuccessTimeoutRef.current to prevent setState after unmount or overlapping
timers.
- Around line 377-389: When entering edit mode the current code parses
preset.settings and preset.mcpServers together and on any parse failure falls
back to using only preset.settings which can drop mcpServers on save; update the
logic in the mode === "edit" branch (the block that calls
setFormName/setFormDescription/setFormJsonText/setFormJsonError) to safely parse
each part individually (e.g., try/parse preset.settings into parsedSettings and
preset.mcpServers into parsedMcpServers), default each to {} on parse failure,
and always call setFormJsonText with JSON.stringify({ settings: parsedSettings,
mcpServers: parsedMcpServers }, null, 2); also set setFormJsonError when either
part fails parsing (or block saving in handleUpdatePreset) so users are aware of
corrupt sub-documents rather than silently losing data.
